title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.8.12-14 | 04-02-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: Brahmastra is a fine weapon, which works on mantra the subtle sound vibration and only a trained person can actually release such a Astra by simply using a mantra ashwatthama discharge the brahmastra simply to kill the Pandavas
segments.summary: The speaker compares the Brahmastra to nuclear weapons, highlighting its precision and lack of indiscriminate harm compared to atomic bombs.

segments.key_quote: Brahmastra marks out the target and proceeds accordingly without harming the innocent
segments.summary: The speaker elaborates on the Brahmastra's ability to specifically target individuals, making it impossible to hide from.

segments.key_quote: Brahmastra is a very very very fine weapon it is uh based on uh the appropriate mantra and only qualified people or trained people can actually use such weapons
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes the Brahmastra's reliance on mantra and the specific targeting of the Pandavas and Uttara's child by Ashwatthama.

segments.key_quote: The Almighty personality of God is Shri Krishna having observed that a great danger was befalling his unalloyed devotees who were fully surrendered souls at once took up his sudarshan disc to protect them
segments.summary: The speaker discusses Krishna's protection of his devotees and the nature of Brahmastra as a product of Vedic mantras.

segments.key_quote: The Advantage of this weapon is that it is not blind like the nuclear weapon this was already discussed in the previous verse because it can be directed only to the target and nothing else
segments.summary: The speaker contrasts the Hare Krishna mantra with destructive mantras and emphasizes the importance of devotees' complete dependence on Krishna for protection.

segments.key_quote: Devotees are always protected by Krishna when they actually learn to depend for protection upon the Supreme Lord only exclusively on the Supreme Lord and not any other means of protection
segments.summary: The speaker highlights Krishna's promise to protect his devotees and the unlimited power he possesses to do so.

segments.key_quote: The Pandavas was cent percent dependent on the protection of the Lord although they were all great warriors themselves
segments.summary: The speaker explains how Krishna's actions are based on the degree of devotional service and the complete dependence of pure devotees like the Pandavas.

segments.key_quote: The lord personally took up his own weapon at the risk of breaking his own vow krishna taken above i will never take any weapon but uh he thought it proper to actually take the weapon his sudarshan chakra in order to protect his devotees
segments.summary: The speaker concludes by emphasizing Krishna's willingness to break his own vow to protect his devotees, highlighting his affectionate nature (Bhaktavatsala).
